"Okay Freeman, be adequate!"
"..."
"What the hell does that mean, anyway?"
"I dunno, sounds like something the Vorts would say..."

"Expected value of zero?"
"That was my nickname in Statistics!"
"Really? Did you score zero on every test?"
"No, but my variance was quite high..."

"There's plenty of room at the bottom."
  -Richard Feynman

"All models are wrong, but some are useful."
  -George Box

"The principle of parsimony, while technically correct, sort of misses the point."
  -William of Ockham

"Well, Papa, can you multiply triplets?"
"No, I can only add and subtract them."
  -William Rowan Hamilton

"Hofstadter's Law: It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take into account Hofstadter's Law."
  -Douglas Hofstadter

"Oh God! To hear the insect on the leaf pronouncing on the
too much life among his hungry brothers in the dust!"
  -Charles Dickens, A Christmas Carol

"...there is no rational explanation for it..."
  -Eugene Wigner

"Then you should say what you mean!"
"I do, at least - at least I mean what I say - that's the same thing, you know."
  -Alice's Adventures in Wonderland

"Spacetime tells matter how to move; matter tells spacetime how to curve."
  -John Wheeler

"An antilibrary is a collection of books that are owned but have not yet been read"
  -Wikipedia

"The aim of science is to make difficult things understandable in a simpler way; the aim of poetry is [the reverse]. The two are incompatible."
  -Paul A.M. Dirac

"God made the integers, all else is the work of man."
  -Leopold Kronecker

"Also, the program itself is probably just a thousand lines of PyTorch.
So, there are more GPUs than lines of code!"
  -Jim Keller

"Form is henceforth divorced from matter."
  -Oliver Wendell Holmes

"The existing scientific concepts cover always only a very limited part of reality,
and the other part that has not yet been understood is infinite."
  -Werner Heisenberg

"When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure."
  -Charles Goodhart

"Truth is ever to be found in simplicity, and not in the multiplicity and confusion of things."
  -Sir Isaac Newton

"The language model has no relationship to the truth.
It is neither on the side of true nor on the side of false;
it is on the side of predicting the most likely next word given the previous words and the training data,
and will pick out or make up things to suit that purpose."
  -Colin Fraser, Meta, Medium

"I, in general, I don't argue with [the software team], I respect them."
  -Wei-han Lien, Tenstorrent

"Either mathematics is too big for the human mind,
or the human mind is more than a machine."
  -Kurt Godel

"Logic, which alone can give certainty, is the instrument of demonstration; intuition is the instrument of invention."
  -Henri Poincare

"I told him that I am interested in biology but not from planet Earth."
  -Avi Loeb

"Python: geared towards children... and PhDs."
  -Carl Kron

"Programming is solving a problem that has already been solved."
  -Unknown

"Why do French people just have one egg for breakfast?
Because one egg is an oeuf."
  -Ian Harding, OHBM2023

"Any application that can be written in JavaScript will eventually be written in JavaScript."
  -Jeff Atwood

"Far it is Practice alone, that makes a Man perfect in any thing."
  -Brook Taylor

"I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals."
  -Winston Churchill

"To make no mistakes is not in the power of man;
but from their errors and mistakes
the wise and good learn wisdom for the future."
  -Plutarch

"Physicists are made up of atoms. A physicist is an attempt by an atom to understand itself."
  -Michio Kaku

"Most of the differential equations that exist cannot be solved.
And most of the differential equations that can be solved cannot be solved by you."
  -Ethan Siegel's Professor

"If Euclid failed to kindle your youthful enthusiasm, then you were not born to be a scientific thinker."
  -Albert Einstein

"Pi is God’s telephone number."
  –Alexander Graham Bell

"When I die. My first query to the devil will be, what is the meaning of the fine structure constant?"
  -Wolfgang Pauli

"A physicist is just an atom’s way of looking at itself."
  -Niels Bohr

"I don't use drugs; my dreams are frightening enough."
  -Maurits Cornelis Escher

"English is to natural languages what JavaScript is to programming languages."
  -Primeagen subscriber (paraphrased)

"In mathematics, you don't understand things. You just get used to them."
  -John von Neumann

"According to all known laws of aviation, the bumblebee cannot fly.
Its body weight is not in the right proportion to its wingspan.
Ignoring these laws, it flies anyway."
  -Andre Saint-Lague

"Hence the euphemism 'the gentleman who pays the rent' came into being
when referring to the family's prized possesion - their pig."
  -Irish American Mom

"Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future."
  -Niels Bohr (disputed)

"There are two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about, and the ones nobody uses."
  -Bjarne Stroustrup
